t: Psalm 44
To the chief Musician for the sons of Korah, Maschil.
We*p have heard with our ears, O God, our fathers have told us, what work thou didst in their days, in the times of old.
How*p thou didst drive out the heathen with thy hand, and plantedst them; how thou didst afflict the people, and cast them out.

For*p they got not the land in possession by their own sword, neither did their own arm save them: but thy right hand, and thine arm, and the light of thy countenance, because thou hadst a favour unto them.
Thou*p art my King, O God: command deliverances for Jacob.
Through*p thee will we push down our enemies: through thy name will we tread them under that rise up against us.
For*p I will not trust in my bow, neither shall my sword save me.
But*p thou hast saved us from our enemies, and hast put them to shame that hated us.
In*p God we boast all the day long, and praise thy name for ever. Selah.
But*p thou hast cast off, and put us to shame; and goest not forth with our armies.
Thou*p makest us to turn back from the enemy: and they which hate us spoil for themselves.
Thou*p hast given us like sheep appointed for meat; and hast scattered us among the heathen.
Thou*p sellest thy people for nought, and dost not increase thy wealth by their price.
Thou*p makest us a reproach to our neighbours, a scorn and a derision to them that are round about us.
Thou*p makest us a byword among the heathen, a shaking of the head among the people.
My*p confusion is continually before me, and the shame of my face hath covered me,
For*p the voice of him that reproacheth and blasphemeth; by reason of the enemy and avenger.
All*p this is come upon us; yet have we not forgotten thee, neither have we dealt falsely in thy covenant.
Our*p heart is not turned back, neither have our steps declined from thy way;
Though*p thou hast sore broken us in the place of dragons, and covered us with the shadow of death.
If*p we have forgotten the name of our God, or stretched out our hands to a strange god;
Shall*p not God search this out? for he knoweth the secrets of the heart.
Yea,*p for thy sake are we killed all the day long; we are counted as sheep for the slaughter.
Awake,*p why sleepest thou, O Lord? arise, cast us not off for ever.
Wherefore*p hidest thou thy face, and forgettest our affliction and our oppression?
For*p our soul is bowed down to the dust: our belly cleaveth unto the earth.
Arise*p for our help, and redeem us for thy mercies' sake.
